task.title: Add setUp and tearDown in manual view of a test case

context.p: In the manual view of a test case, you can add the setUp and tearDown method by following these steps:

step.cmd: Click on the drop-down button of the icon and choose . To learn more about the method statement, see Define Method.
Enter your method's name and its return value, then choose one of the options below:

row.entry: This method is always called first, before executing the main test steps.
This method is called after executing all steps of the test case, if one of those steps is marked as Failed.
This method is called after executing all steps of the test case, if all of those steps are marked as Pass.
This method is called after executing all the test case steps, if one of those steps is marked as Error.
This method is called at the end of an execution.

step.cmd: To add a test step under a method, choose the line of that method, then click .
step.stepresult:
A new keyword is added under that method.
tearDown step added to a test case
The setUp/tearDown methods might be marked as Error if any issue occurs during their execution. The possible exception is when the AssertionError class is used, or if the methods are skipped.
